results.title: The Sensory world (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: CRM Educational Films, Philip Mendlow, Tom Lazarus and Joel Gold
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology Today”
Examines and demonstrates the empirical mechanics of human perception or misperception of our environments and the functioning - both normal and impaired - of the human senses. Uses animation to demonstrate various phenomena of the brain and illustrates its functions. Includes explanation of experiments with optic fibres and with electrical stimulation of the human brain and the memory.
Suitable for upper secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: The Senses of man
results.creator_credit: Gateway Educational Films and Indiana University. Audio Visual Center
results.brief_description: Shows the importance of sense receptors of temperature, pressure, touch and pain. Discusses health considerations pertaining to the senses. A film from the Human Physiology series.

results.title: The Senses
results.creator_credit: Sigma Educational Films and Gabor Kalman
results.brief_description: Hearing, seeing, tasting, smelling, and touching are senses which help animals and birds to know their world. Young children are encouraged to use their senses to enrich the experience of their own environment.

results.title: The Senior service
results.brief_description: Photographed aboard the training ship, HMAS Australia, the film illustrates how young recruits are receiving practical instruction in technical trades and seamanship, preparing them for a career of travel and adventure in the Royal Australian Navy. The action of the film culminates in exercises, staged off the Tasmanian coast, in which naval forces from different parts of the British Commonwealth took part.

results.title: The Selfish giant (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Reiner Film, Murray Shostak and Peter Sander
results.brief_description: Animated interpretation of Oscar Wilde’s allegory about selfishness, sharing, and love. A beautiful garden is beset by perpetual winter after a greedy giant forbids children to play there. Then he is compelled to help a mysterious child who has entered the garden and spring comes. At his life’s end this child leads the giant to another garden.

results.title: The Self made man
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisors Problem”

Provides supervisors of office personnel with a dramatised case history that will stimulate discussion of the factors that lead to successful self development. Based on actual experience, the supervisors can identify themselves with the problem.

results.title: The Self
results.creator_credit: WGBH (Boston), Tuggelin Yourgrau and David Espar
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
The Self, or self concept, is the individual’s awareness of his or her continuing identity as a person. It acts as an internal regulator of thoughts, feelings and behaviour which interprets and organises our ongoing experiences. It reflects on how our present actions compare with our standards and expectations - and it affects our performance by providing plans, scripts and incentives. In this program, Philip Zimbardo examines the psychology of Self, including the theories of William James, Freud’s categories of id, ego and superego, Carl Rogers humanistic psychology of self and Albert Bandura’s theory of self-efficacy.
